metadata.subject: Pompeo Is Chosen to Lead State Dept. / Haspel Ousted as Trump Silences Dissent in Cabinet

relationships.description: President appointing new Secretary of State
Clandestine officer involved in counterterrorism operations

analysis.purpose: To report on Trump administration personnel changes and Gina Haspel's background
analysis.significance: Documents significant cabinet reshuffling and controversial CIA appointment related to interrogation programs

concerns: Mentions of waterboarding and brutal interrogation techniques
Reference to CIA's rendition, detention and interrogation program

notable_quotes: "the agency's rendition, detention and interrogation program, which shaped her career"
"waterboarded a Qaeda suspect three times and subjected him to brutal interrogation techniques"
red_flags: Appointment of official involved in secret prison operations

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion in this news article

illegal_activity.description: This is a New York Times article reporting on government activities and personnel changes, not first-hand evidence of illegal activity

details: Article by Adam Goldman, Mark Landler, Maggie Haberman and Gardiner Harris

public_knowledge.context: This is a published New York Times article about Trump administration personnel changes and CIA interrogation programs that were publicly reported

analysis.summary: New York Times article reporting on President Trump replacing Secretary of State Rex Tillerson with CIA Director Mike Pompeo, while also covering Gina Haspel's background running a secret CIA prison in Thailand where waterboarding and brutal interrogation techniques were used.
